title: RBI Grade B - ESI - FLM1 - Objective
instruction: Continued record illicit drug supply and increasingly agile trafficking networks are compounding intersecting global crises and challenging health services and law enforcement responses, according to the X launched by the UN Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

quiz.text: As per the paragraph, SWAMIH fund is sponsored by the ____________.
options: Ministry of Finance
World Bank
European Investment Bank
Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
3 and 4

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to the eligibility of projects to receive SWAMIH funding?
options: Projects must be very close to completion.
RERA-registered projects which have been stalled due to a lack of adequate funds.
Flats that do not measure more than 500 square metres in carpet area.
Flats that are priced up to INR 2 crore in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to Tele-Law?
options: It was launched in 2017.
It is an e-interface mechanism to seek legal advice and consultation at a pre-litigation stage.
Advice is free of Cost to those who are eligible for free legal aid under Section 12 of LSA (legal service authority) Act, 1987.
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the National Family Health Survey 2019-21 (NFHS-5), what percentage of women between the age of 20 and 24 were married before 18 years of age?
options: 47%
27%
23%
10%
5%

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), India has joined the Champions Group of the Global Crisis Response Group (GCRG). Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to GCRG?1.      It was established in March 2022.2.      GCRG was set up by the World Bank.3.      The GCRG is overseen by the Champions Group comprising of HOS/ HOGs of Bangladesh, Barbados, Denmark, Germany, Indonesia and Senegal.
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
3 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), UNGA (United Nations General Assembly) has elected 5 new non-permanent members of UNSC (United Nations Security Council). Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to UNSC? 1.   It was established in 1948. 2.   It is one of the five principal organs of the United Nations. 3.   Duration of non-permanent members in UNSC is four years. 4.   UNSC has 5 permanent members and 15 non-permanent members.
options: 1 and 2
2, 3 and 4
4 only
None of the above
All of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is/are incorrect with respect to incentives under the scheme described in above passage? A. Development Capital Support (DCS) is provided to investors to set up production facilities to incentivize manufacturing units to get established. B. Under DCS, Greenfield Park: support will be 30% of Project Cost, with a cap of ₹ 500 Crore per Park. C. Competitiveness Incentive Support (CIS) is used for creation of Core Infrastructures.
options: Only B
A and B
A, B and C
A and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Above scheme is inspired by the 5F vision of Prime Minister of India, what does 5F stand for?
options: Farm to Fibre to Factory to Foreign to Fashion
Fibre to Farm to Factory to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Fibre to Factory to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Factory to Fibre to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Fibre to Fashion to Factory to Foreign

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the above Scheme? A. 1st PM MITRA Park is to be established in Virudhunagar District of Telangana. B. Parks will be developed by a Special Purpose Vehicle which will be owned by State Government (49%) and Government of India (51%) in a Public Private Partnership (PPP) Mode. C. Parks are setup on the basis of proposals received from State Governments having ready availability of contiguous and encumbrance-free land parcel of minimum 1000 acres.
options: A and B
Only B
Only A
Only C
A, B and C

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) - Phase-II – [SBM(G)- Phase-II]? A. Under SBM(G) Phase-II, GOBAR-dhan (Galvanizing Organic Bio-Agro Resources-dhan) initiative has been launched to convert bio-waste into biogas and bio slurry. B. ODF Plus declaration of villages is done under 4 categories. C. ODF Plus village - sustains its ODF status, ensures solid and liquid waste management and is visually clean.
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
A and B
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are the components of Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) Phase II? 1. Construction of Clustered Household Latrines 2. Retrofitting of toilets 3. Construction of Community Sanitary Complexes (CSCs)
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
Only 3
All of the Above

quiz.text: The SBM-G program has positively impacted the health and well-being of millions across India. Regarding plastic waste management, 831 plastic waste management units and 1,19,449 waste collection & segregation sheds have been established. All Union Territories of Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Dadra Nagar Havelli & Daman Diu, and Lakshadweep boast 100% ODF Plus Model villages. What is correct sequence among the top-performing states in descending order as in May-2023?
options: (A) Telangana (100%)>Kerala (99.5%)>Tamil Nadu (97.8%)>Uttar Pradesh (95.2%)
(B) Telangana (100%)>Karnataka (98.5%)>Tamil Nadu (97.8%)>Uttar Pradesh (93.2%)
(C) Telangana (100%)>Karnataka (99.5%)>Tamil Nadu (95.8%)>Uttar Pradesh (95.2%)
(D) Telangana (100%)>Karnataka (99.5%)>Tamil Nadu (97.8%)>Uttar Pradesh (95.2%)
(E) Telangana (100%)>Karnataka (97.5%)>Tamil Nadu (95.8%)>Uttar Pradesh (92.2%)

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Women and Child Development. B. It was announced in Union Budget 2021-22 by merging supplementary nutrition programmes and POSHAN Abhiyaan. C. It will contribute to Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), specifically, SDG 2 on Quality Education  and SDG 4 on Zero Hunger.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are covered under above scheme? A. Anganwadi Services B. Poshan Abhiyaan C. PM POshan SHAkti Nirman (PM-POSHAN)
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is/are correct with respect to above programme?
options: Anganwadi Services is open to all eligible beneficiaries on demand, irrespective of caste, religion and income criteria.
Early Childhood Care and Education (6-18 years) and early stimulation for (3-6 years) is provided as primary vertical.
Migration facility for pregnant women and lactating mothers from one Anganwadi Centre (AWC) to another within and outside a State is not allowed.
Only A & B
All of the above are correct

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways. B. It was launched in the year 2015. C. Sagarmala Development Company Limited (SDCL) established via the Companies Act, 2013 with an initial Authorized Share Capital of Rs. 5,000 Crore and a Subscribed Share Capital of Rs. 2500 Crore will provide equity support for the projects.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not one of the component under the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Port Modernization & New Port Development
Port Connectivity Enhancement
Port-linked Industrialization
Coastal  Waterways Transport & Inland Shipping
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following  bank account holders are eligible under this scheme? A. Chitransh who is 75 years of age B. Praveen who is a NRIs but holds bank account with a bank branch located in India C. Rajesh and Kiran who are Joint bank account holders
options: B and C
A and B
A and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are the eligibility criterion under Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maan Dhan Yojana? A. Entry age between 18 to 40 years B. Cultivable land up to 5 hectares C. Aadhar Card is mandatory
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the above scheme?
options: These bonds cannot be used as collateral for loans.
Rate of interest under this scheme is 2.5% per annum.
Tenure of the bond is 8 years.
Early encashment/redemption of the bond is allowed after fifth year.
Capital gains tax arising on redemption of bonds to an individual is exempted.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with respect to the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY)? 1. Only the BPL ration card will be considered for the purpose of family identification. 2. Aadhar based eKYC is mandatory for enrolment, except in the states of Assam and Meghalaya. 3. In case of no adult female member available, a joint LPG connection can be issued in the name of eldest male family member along with a minor female member of the house.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Mangrove Initiative for Shoreline Habitats & Tangible Incomes (MISHTI) promotes the Promotes development of _______ Mangroves across 11 states and 2 Union Territories.
options: 240 Sq. Kms
340 Sq. Kms
440 Sq. Kms
540 Sq. Kms
640 Sq. Kms

quiz.text:
Which of the following states will be covered under the Marketing and Logistics Development for Promotion of Tribal Products from North Eastern Region (PTP-NER) scheme?

A. Arunachal Pradesh

B. Assam

C. Sikkim
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the Amrit Bharat Station scheme? A. High level platforms (600-740 mm) shall be provided at all categories of stations. B. Master Plan should have suitable spaces earmarked for 5G towers. C. Amenities for Divyangjan at stations shall be as per guidelines issued by Railway Board.
options: B and C
A and C
A and B
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Under the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups, the credit guarantee cover would be transaction based and umbrella based. Which one of the following is correct with respect to the extent of transaction-based cover?

A. 80% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is up to Rs. 3 crore.

B. 90% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 3 crore, and up to Rs. 5 crore.

C. 65% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 5 crore.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the X report which was launched recently (July 2023) by the World Bank and the WTO, India has doubled its share of global commercial services exports to ______ in 2022 from 2% in 2005.
options: 4.4%
4.5%
4.9%
3.4%
5.3%

quiz.text: According to the X report recently (July 2023) India has become a popular destination for medical travel and hosted around _______ foreign patients from 2009 to 2019.
options: 1.5 million
4.5 million
3.5 million
3.3 million
3.4 million

quiz.text: According to X, recently (In June) released by the FAO, the world rice production is forecast to rise by 1.3 per cent in 2023-24 to __________.
options: 432.5 million tonnes
528.5 million tonnes
523.5 million tonnes
433.6 million tonnes
345.9 million tonnes

quiz.text: According to the recently (In June) released X report by the World Economic Forum, India was ranked at __________ out of 146 countries an improvement of eight places from last year.
options: 123
137
127
117
125

quiz.text: According to recently (In June) released X report by the UN office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), global estimate of people who inject drugs in 2021 are ___________.
options: 15 million
10 million
13.2 million
12 million
12.6 million
